text: Who succeeded Moses as the leader of Israel?
verseText: After the death of Moses the servant of the LORD, the LORD said to Joshua the son of Nun, Moses' assistant, 'Moses my servant is dead. Now therefore arise, go over this Jordan, you and all this people, into the land that I am giving to them, to the people of Israel.' (ESV)

text: What river did the Israelites cross to enter the Promised Land?
verseText: And the priests bearing the ark of the covenant of the LORD stood firmly on dry ground in the midst of the Jordan, and all Israel was passing over on dry ground until all the nation finished passing over the Jordan. (ESV)

text: What was the name of the first city the Israelites conquered in Canaan?
verseText: So the people shouted, and the trumpets were blown. As soon as the people heard the sound of the trumpet, the people shouted a great shout, and the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they captured the city. (ESV)

text: How many spies did Joshua send to Jericho?
verseText: And Joshua the son of Nun sent two men secretly from Shittim as spies, saying, 'Go, view the land, especially Jericho.' And they went and came into the house of a prostitute whose name was Rahab and lodged there. (ESV)

text: Who hid the spies in Jericho?
verseText: But the woman had taken the two men and hidden them. And she said, 'True, the men came to me, but I did not know where they were from.' (ESV)

text: What did the Israelites march around Jericho for seven days?
verseText: So Joshua the son of Nun called the priests and said to them, 'Take up the ark of the covenant and let seven priests bear seven trumpets of rams' horns before the ark of the LORD.' (ESV)

text: What happened to the walls of Jericho?
verseText: So the people shouted, and the trumpets were blown. As soon as the people heard the sound of the trumpet, the people shouted a great shout, and the wall fell down flat... (ESV)

text: What was the sign Rahab used to protect her family?
verseText: Behold, when we come into the land, you shall tie this scarlet cord in the window through which you let us down, and you shall gather into your house your father and mother, your brothers, and all your father's household. (ESV)

text: Who sinned by taking devoted things from Jericho?
verseText: But the people of Israel broke faith in regard to the devoted things, for Achan the son of Carmi, son of Zabdi, son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took some of the devoted things. And the anger of the LORD burned against the people of Israel. (ESV)

text: What happened at the battle of Ai initially?
verseText: So about three thousand men went up there from the people. And they fled before the men of Ai, and the men of Ai killed about thirty-six of their men and chased them before the gate as far as Shebarim and struck them at the descent. And the hearts of the people melted and became as water. (ESV)

text: What did God command Joshua to be?
verseText: Be strong and courageous, for you shall cause this people to inherit the land that I swore to their fathers to give them. (ESV)

text: What memorial was set up after crossing the Jordan?
verseText: And the people of Israel did just as Joshua commanded and took up twelve stones out of the midst of the Jordan... And Joshua set up twelve stones in the midst of the Jordan, in the place where the feet of the priests bearing the ark of the covenant had stood; and they are there to this day. (ESV)

text: What happened to the flow of the Jordan River when the priests stepped into it?
options: It parted like the Red Sea
verseText: the waters coming down from above stood and rose up in a heap very far away, at Adam, the city that is beside Zarethan, and those flowing down toward the Sea of the Arabah, the Salt Sea, were completely cut off. And the people passed over opposite Jericho. (ESV)

text: Who was the other spy, besides Joshua, who survived the wilderness wanderings?
verseText: not one shall come into the land where I swore that I would make you dwell, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun. (ESV)

text: What did the Gibeonites trick Israel into doing?
verseText: And Joshua made peace with them and made a covenant with them, to let them live, and the leaders of the congregation swore to them. (ESV)

text: What miracle occurred during the battle against the five Amorite kings?
verseText: And the sun stood still, and the moon stopped, until the nation took vengeance on their enemies. Is this not written in the Book of Jashar? The sun stopped in the midst of heaven and did not hurry to set for about a whole day. (ESV)

text: After conquering the land, what did Joshua do?
options: Divided the land among the tribes
verseText: Now therefore divide this land for an inheritance to the nine tribes and half the tribe of Manasseh. (ESV)

text: Which tribe received no territorial inheritance?
verseText: To the tribe of Levi alone Moses gave no inheritance. The offerings by fire to the LORD God of Israel are their inheritance, as he said to him. (ESV)

text: How old was Joshua when he died?
verseText: After these things Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of the LORD, died, being 110 years old. (ESV)

text: What choice did Joshua famously give the Israelites before he died?
verseText: And if it is evil in your eyes to serve the LORD, choose this day whom you will serve, whether the gods your fathers served in the region beyond the River, or the gods of the Amorites in whose land you dwell. But as for me and my house, we will serve the LORD. (ESV)

text: Where were the Israelites circumcised after crossing the Jordan?
verseText: So Joshua made flint knives and circumcised the sons of Israel at Gibeath-haaraloth. (ESV) [Note: Gibeath-haaraloth is at Gilgal, see v. 9]

text: What stopped happening after the Israelites ate the produce of Canaan?
verseText: And the manna ceased the day after they ate of the produce of the land. And there was no longer manna for the people of Israel, but they ate of the fruit of the land of Canaan that year. (ESV)

text: Who appeared to Joshua near Jericho before the battle?
options: The commander of the army of the LORD
verseText: When Joshua was by Jericho, he lifted up his eyes and looked, and behold, a man was standing before him with his drawn sword in his hand. And Joshua went to him and said to him, 'Are you for us, or for our adversaries?' And he said, 'No; but I am the commander of the army of the LORD. Now I have come.' (ESV)

text: How many times did the Israelites march around Jericho on the seventh day?
verseText: On the seventh day they rose early, at the dawn of day, and marched around the city in the same manner seven times. It was only on that day that they marched around the city seven times. (ESV)

text: What did the priests blow as they marched around Jericho?
verseText: Let seven priests bear seven trumpets of rams' horns before the ark. On the seventh day you shall march around the city seven times, and the priests shall blow the trumpets. (ESV)

text: What was the consequence for Achan's sin?
options: He and his family were stoned and burned
verseText: And Joshua said, 'Why did you bring trouble on us? The LORD brings trouble on you today.' And all Israel stoned him with stones. They burned them with fire and stoned them with stones. (ESV)

text: What did the Gibeonites pretend to be?
verseText: they on their part acted with cunning and went and made ready provisions and took worn-out sacks for their donkeys, and wineskins, worn-out and torn and mended, (ESV)

text: What job were the Gibeonites given after their deception was discovered?
verseText: But Joshua made them that day cutters of wood and drawers of water for the congregation and for the altar of the LORD, to this day, in the place that he should choose. (ESV)

text: Where did Joshua gather the tribes for his final address?
verseText: Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel to Shechem and summoned the elders, the heads, the judges, and the officers of Israel. And they presented themselves before God. (ESV)

text: What did Joshua set up under an oak tree at Shechem as a witness?
verseText: And Joshua wrote these words in the Book of the Law of God. And he took a large stone and set it up there under the terebinth that was by the sanctuary of the LORD. And Joshua said to all the people, 'Behold, this stone shall be a witness against us...' (ESV)

text: What did God tell Joshua regarding the Book of the Law?
options: Meditate on it day and night
verseText: This Book of the Law shall not depart from your mouth, but you shall meditate on it day and night, so that you may be careful to do according to all that is written in it. For then you will make your way prosperous, and then you will have good success. (ESV)

text: What items were carried by the priests into the Jordan River?
verseText: And Joshua said to the priests, 'Take up the ark of the covenant and pass on before the people.' So they took up the ark of the covenant and went before the people. (ESV)

text: Why did the Israelites need to be circumcised at Gilgal?
options: The generation born in the wilderness was not circumcised
It was a command for entering the land
As a sign of the covenant with Rahab
verseText: Though all the people who came out had been circumcised, yet all the people who were born on the way in the wilderness after they had come out of Egypt had not been circumcised. (ESV)

text: What instruction did the commander of the LORD's army give Joshua?
verseText: And the commander of the LORD's army said to Joshua, 'Take off your sandals from your feet, for the place where you are standing is holy.' And Joshua did so. (ESV)

text: What specific instruction was given regarding the city of Jericho after its destruction?
options: It should be given to Rahab
verseText: Joshua laid an oath upon them at that time, saying, 'Cursed before the LORD be the man who rises up and rebuilds this city, Jericho. At the cost of his firstborn shall he lay its foundation, and at the cost of his youngest son shall he set up its gates.' (ESV)

text: What items did Achan take from Jericho?
options: A robe, silver, and a bar of gold
verseText: when I saw among the spoil a beautiful cloak from Shinar, and 200 shekels of silver, and a bar of gold weighing 50 shekels, then I coveted them and took them. And see, they are hidden in the earth inside my tent, with the silver underneath. (ESV)

text: How did the Israelites eventually capture Ai?
verseText: He took about 5,000 men and set them in ambush between Bethel and Ai, to the west of the city. (ESV)

text: Where did Joshua build an altar and write the Law of Moses on stones?
verseText: At that time Joshua built an altar to the LORD, the God of Israel, on Mount Ebal... And there, in the presence of the people of Israel, he wrote on the stones a copy of the law of Moses, which he had written. (ESV)

text: What did the Gibeonites wear to deceive the Israelites?
verseText: with worn-out, patched sandals on their feet, and worn-out clothes. And all their provisions were dry and crumbly. (ESV)

text: Why did the Israelites fail to consult the LORD before making the treaty with Gibeon?
verseText: So the men took some of their provisions, but did not ask counsel from the LORD. (ESV)

text: Which five Amorite kings attacked Gibeon?
options: Kings of Jerusalem, Hebron, Jarmuth, Lachish, Eglon
Kings of Jericho, Ai, Bethel, Shechem, Tirzah
Kings of Hazor, Madon, Shimron, Achshaph
Kings of Edom, Moab, Ammon, Philistia, Amalek
verseText: Then the five kings of the Amorites, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon, gathered their forces and went up with all their armies and encamped against Gibeon and made war against it. (ESV)

text: What did God throw down on the Amorites as they fled from Israel?
verseText: And as they fled before Israel, while they were going down the ascent of Beth-horon, the LORD threw down large stones from heaven on them as far as Azekah, and they died. There were more who died because of the hailstones than the sons of Israel killed with the sword. (ESV)

text: Where is the event of the sun standing still recorded, besides Joshua?
verseText: And the sun stood still, and the moon stopped, until the nation took vengeance on their enemies. Is this not written in the Book of Jashar? (ESV)

text: Who led the northern coalition of kings against Joshua?
verseText: When Jabin king of Hazor heard of this, he sent to Jobab king of Madon, and to the king of Shimron, and to the king of Achshaph, (ESV)

text: What did Joshua do to the horses and chariots of the northern kings?
options: Hamstrung the horses and burned the chariots
verseText: And Joshua did to them just as the LORD told him: he hamstrung their horses and burned their chariots with fire. (ESV)

text: Which tribes settled east of the Jordan River?
verseText: With the other half of the tribe of Manasseh the Reubenites and the Gadites received their inheritance, which Moses gave them, beyond the Jordan eastward, as Moses the servant of the LORD gave them. (ESV)

text: What city did Caleb request as his inheritance?
verseText: Then Joshua blessed him, and he gave Hebron to Caleb the son of Jephunneh for an inheritance. Therefore Hebron became the inheritance of Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite to this day, because he wholly followed the LORD, the God of Israel. (ESV)

text: Who were the inhabitants of Hebron that Caleb drove out?
verseText: And Caleb drove out from there the three sons of Anak, Sheshai and Ahiman and Talmai, the descendants of Anak. (ESV)

text: What were the cities designated as 'cities of refuge' for?
verseText: Say to the people of Israel, 'Appoint the cities of refuge, of which I spoke to you through Moses, that the manslayer who kills any person without intent or unknowingly may flee there. They shall be for you a refuge from the avenger of blood.' (ESV)

text: How many cities of refuge were there in total?
verseText: So they set apart Kedesh in Galilee... Shechem... Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron)... and beyond the Jordan east of Jericho... Bezer... Ramoth in Gilead... and Golan in Bashan... (ESV)

text: How many cities were given to the Levites?
verseText: The cities of the Levites in the midst of the possession of the people of Israel were in all forty-eight cities with their pasturelands. (ESV)

text: Why did the western tribes prepare for war against the eastern tribes in Joshua 22?
options: The eastern tribes built an altar by the Jordan
The eastern tribes refused to help in battle
The eastern tribes claimed more land
verseText: And the people of Israel heard it said, 'Behold, the people of Reuben and the people of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh have built the altar at the frontier of the land of Canaan...' And when the people of Israel heard of it, the whole assembly of the people of Israel gathered at Shiloh to make war against them. (ESV)

text: What was the purpose of the altar built by the eastern tribes?
options: As a witness between them and the western tribes
verseText: but that it may be a witness between us and you, and between our generations after us, that we do perform the service of the LORD in his presence with our burnt offerings and sacrifices and peace offerings, lest your children say to our children in time to come, "You have no portion in the LORD."' (ESV)

text: What warning did Joshua give about intermarrying with the remaining Canaanites?
options: They would become snares and traps
verseText: For if you turn back and cling to the remnant of these nations remaining among you and make marriages with them... know for certain that the LORD your God will no longer drive out these nations before you, but they shall be a snare and a trap for you, a whip on your sides and thorns in your eyes... (ESV)

text: Where were the bones of Joseph buried?
verseText: As for the bones of Joseph, which the people of Israel brought up from Egypt, they buried them at Shechem, in the piece of land that Jacob bought from the sons of Hamor the father of Shechem for a hundred pieces of money. It became an inheritance of the descendants of Joseph. (ESV)

text: What happened to the manna when the Israelites ate the produce of Canaan?
verseText: And the manna ceased the day after they ate of the produce of the land. And there was no longer manna for the people of Israel, but they ate of the fruit of the land of Canaan that year. (ESV)

text: What valley was Achan stoned in?
verseText: And they raised over him a great heap of stones that remains to this day. Then the LORD turned from his burning anger. Therefore, to this day the name of that place is called the Valley of Achor. (ESV)

text: Which tribe's inheritance was within the territory of Judah?
verseText: The second lot came out for Simeon, for the tribe of the people of Simeon, according to their clans, and their inheritance was in the midst of the inheritance of the people of Judah... The inheritance of the people of Simeon formed part of the territory of the people of Judah. (ESV)

text: What city was given to Joshua as his personal inheritance?
verseText: When they had finished distributing the several territories of the land as inheritances, the people of Israel gave an inheritance among them to Joshua the son of Nun. By command of the LORD they gave him the city that he asked, Timnath-serah in the hill country of Ephraim. And he rebuilt the city and settled in it. (ESV)

text: Who was the priest who assisted Joshua in dividing the land?
verseText: These are the inheritances that the people of Israel received in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest and Joshua the son of Nun and the heads of the fathers' houses of the tribes of the people of Israel distributed to them. (ESV)

text: What did Joshua remind the Israelites God had done for them in his farewell address?
verseText: And you have seen all that the LORD your God has done to all these nations for your sake, for it is the LORD your God who has fought for you. (ESV)

text: What was the name of Caleb's daughter, offered to the one who captured Kiriath-sepher?
verseText: And Caleb said, 'Whoever strikes Kiriath-sepher and captures it, to him will I give Achsah my daughter as wife.' (ESV)

text: Who captured Kiriath-sepher (Debir) and married Caleb's daughter?
verseText: And Othniel the son of Kenaz, the brother of Caleb, captured it. And he gave him Achsah his daughter as wife. (ESV)

text: What did Achsah ask her father Caleb for?
verseText: She said to him, 'Give me a blessing. Since you have given me the land of the Negeb, give me also springs of water.' And he gave her the upper springs and the lower springs. (ESV)

text: Which nation's territory were the Israelites explicitly told NOT to take?
verseText: And command the people, ‘You are about to pass through the territory of your brothers, the people of Esau, who live in Seir... Do not contend with them, for I will not give you any of their land...’ (ESV) [Context for Joshua's campaigns]

text: Where was the Tabernacle set up after the initial conquest?
verseText: Then the whole congregation of the people of Israel assembled at Shiloh and set up the tent of meeting there. The land lay subdued before them. (ESV)

text: How was the land divided among the remaining seven tribes at Shiloh?
verseText: And Joshua cast lots for them in Shiloh before the LORD. And there Joshua apportioned the land to the people of Israel, to each his portion. (ESV)

text: Which group of people were not completely driven out by the tribe of Ephraim?
verseText: However, they did not drive out the Canaanites who lived in Gezer, so the Canaanites have lived in the midst of Ephraim to this day but have been made to do forced labor. (ESV)

text: Which group of people were not completely driven out by the tribe of Judah from Jerusalem?
verseText: But the Jebusites, the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the people of Judah could not drive out, so the Jebusites dwell with the people of Judah at Jerusalem to this day. (ESV)

text: What did Joshua command the officers to tell the people before crossing the Jordan?
verseText: 'Pass through the midst of the camp and command the people, "Prepare your provisions, for within three days you are to pass over this Jordan to go in to take possession of the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess."' (ESV)

text: What was the name of the place where the Israelites camped just before crossing the Jordan?
verseText: Then Joshua rose early in the morning, and they set out from Shittim. And they came to the Jordan, he and all the people of Israel, and lodged there before they passed over. (ESV)

text: What does the name 'Gilgal' likely mean, according to Joshua 5?
verseText: And the LORD said to Joshua, 'Today I have rolled away the reproach of Egypt from you.' And so the name of that place is called Gilgal to this day. (ESV)

text: What feast did the Israelites celebrate at Gilgal after the circumcision?
verseText: While the people of Israel were encamped at Gilgal, they kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the month in the evening on the plains of Jericho. (ESV)

text: What was the specific instruction regarding the silver, gold, bronze, and iron from Jericho?
options: Consecrate them to the LORD's treasury
verseText: But all silver and gold, and every vessel of bronze and iron, are holy to the LORD; they shall go into the treasury of the LORD. (ESV)

text: From which tribe was Achan, who sinned regarding the devoted things?
verseText: But the people of Israel broke faith in regard to the devoted things, for Achan the son of Carmi, son of Zabdi, son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took some of the devoted things. (ESV)

text: How many men did Joshua initially set for the ambush against Ai?
verseText: So Joshua arose, and all the fighting men, to go up to Ai. And Joshua chose 30,000 mighty men of valor and sent them out by night. (ESV) [Note: v. 12 mentions 5,000, possibly a second group or textual variant]

text: What signal did Joshua use to initiate the ambush on Ai?
verseText: Then the LORD said to Joshua, 'Stretch out the javelin that is in your hand toward Ai, for I will give it into your hand.' And Joshua stretched out the javelin that was in his hand toward the city. (ESV)

text: Which mountain was designated for pronouncing the blessings?
verseText: And all Israel... stood on opposite sides of the ark before the Levitical priests... half of them in front of Mount Gerizim and half of them in front of Mount Ebal... first, to bless the people of Israel. (ESV)

text: What happened to the five Amorite kings after the battle of Gibeon?
options: Hid in a cave, then executed
verseText: These five kings fled and hid themselves in the cave at Makkedah... And afterward Joshua struck them and put them to death, and he hanged them on five trees. (ESV)

text: What was the name of the place where the northern kings gathered against Israel?
verseText: And all these kings joined their forces and came and encamped together at the waters of Merom to fight against Israel. (ESV)

text: How many kings did Joshua defeat west of the Jordan, according to the list in Joshua 12?
verseText: the king of Tirzah, one. In all, thirty-one kings. (ESV)

text: What specific areas remained unconquered when Joshua was old?
options: Philistine lands, Geshurites, parts of Lebanon
verseText: Now Joshua was old and advanced in years, and the LORD said to him, 'You are old and advanced in years, and there remains yet very much land to possess. This is the land that yet remains: all the regions of the Philistines, and all those of the Geshurites...'

text: Who was the father of Achsah, Caleb's daughter?
verseText: And Caleb said, 'Whoever strikes Kiriath-sepher and captures it, to him will I give Achsah my daughter as wife.' (ESV)

text: What was the original name of Hebron, before Caleb received it?
verseText: Now the name of Hebron formerly was Kiriath-arba. (Arba was the greatest man among the Anakim.) And the land had rest from war. (ESV)

text: Which tribe complained that their allotted territory was too small?
options: The tribes of Joseph (Ephraim and Manasseh)
verseText: Then the people of Joseph spoke to Joshua, saying, 'Why have you given me but one lot and one portion as an inheritance, although I am a numerous people, since the LORD has blessed me thus far?' (ESV)

text: What did Joshua tell the tribes of Joseph to do about their small territory?
options: Clear the forest land in the hill country
verseText: And Joshua said to them, 'If you are a numerous people, go up by yourselves to the forest, and there clear ground for yourselves in the land of the Perizzites and the Rephaim, since the hill country of Ephraim is too narrow for you.' (ESV)

text: How many men were chosen to survey the remaining land for the seven tribes?
verseText: Appoint three men from each tribe, and I will send them out that they may set out and go up and down the land. They shall write a description of it with a view to their inheritances, and then come to me. (ESV)

text: Which city of refuge was located east of the Jordan in the territory of Reuben?
verseText: And beyond the Jordan east of Jericho, they appointed Bezer in the wilderness on the tableland, from the tribe of Reuben... (ESV)

text: Which Levitical family group received Hebron as one of their cities?
verseText: And the lot came out for the clans of the Kohathites... to the sons of Aaron the priest... They gave them Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron), the city of refuge for the manslayer, with its pasturelands... (ESV)

text: Who was the priest sent to confront the eastern tribes about their altar?
verseText: Then the people of Israel sent to the people of Reuben and the people of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh, in the land of Gilead, Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, (ESV)

text: What previous incident of rebellion did Phinehas remind the eastern tribes of?
verseText: Have we not had enough of the sin at Peor, from which even yet we have not cleansed ourselves, and for which there came a plague upon the congregation of the LORD...? (ESV)

text: What name did the eastern tribes give their altar?
verseText: The people of Reuben and the people of Gad called the altar Witness, 'For,' they said, 'it is a witness between us that the LORD is God.' (ESV) [Note: 'Witness' (Ed) is supplied in some translations based on context/manuscripts]

text: Joshua warned that if Israel served other gods, God's anger would burn and they would...
options: Perish quickly from the good land
verseText: if you transgress the covenant of the LORD your God, which he commanded you, and go and serve other gods and bow down to them. Then the anger of the LORD will be kindled against you, and you shall perish quickly from off the good land that he has given to you. (ESV)

text: Which patriarch's history did Joshua recount in his final address at Shechem?
verseText: And Joshua said to all the people, 'Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, "Long ago, your fathers lived beyond the Euphrates, Terah, the father of Abraham and of Nahor; and they served other gods. Then I took your father Abraham from beyond the River..."' (Recounts history through Exodus and conquest) (ESV)

text: Who died and was buried at the end of the book of Joshua, besides Joshua?
verseText: And Eleazar the son of Aaron died, and they buried him at Gibeah, the town of Phinehas his son, which had been given him in the hill country of Ephraim. (ESV)

text: What was Rahab's profession?
verseText: And they went and came into the house of a prostitute whose name was Rahab and lodged there. (ESV)

text: How far were the people supposed to stay behind the Ark of the Covenant when crossing the Jordan?
options: As far as they could see
verseText: Yet there shall be a distance between you and it, about 2,000 cubits in length. Do not come near it, in order that you may know the way you shall go, for you have not passed this way before. (ESV)

text: What happened to the king of Ai after the city was captured?
options: Hanged on a tree until evening
verseText: And he hanged the king of Ai on a tree until evening. And at sunset Joshua commanded, and they took his body down from the tree and threw it at the entrance of the gate of the city and raised over it a great heap of stones, which stands there to this day. (ESV)

text: Which tribe initially failed to drive out the inhabitants of the coastal plain (later associated with Philistines)?
verseText: When the territory of the people of Dan was lost to them, the people of Dan went up and fought against Leshem, and after capturing it and striking it with the sword, they took possession of it and settled in it, calling Leshem, Dan, after the name of Dan their ancestor. (ESV) [Implies displacement due to pressure]

text: What specific phrase indicates the completeness of the initial conquest under Joshua?
options: The land had rest from war
verseText: So Joshua took the whole land, according to all that the LORD had spoken to Moses. And Joshua gave it for an inheritance to Israel according to their tribal allotments. And the land had rest from war. (ESV)
